meanings.definition: A large retail store selling a wide variety of goods.
meanings.sent1: The emporium in town offers everything from clothes to toys.
meanings.sent2: I visited the emporium to buy some new kitchen supplies.
meanings.sent3: At the emporium, you can find a hat for your pet elephant!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an emporium of ideas, each one more colorful than the last.
meanings.sent5: The emporium was a treasure trove of delights, beckoning shoppers inside.

meanings.definition: A place where a particular kind of business is carried on.
meanings.sent1: The bustling emporium was filled with vendors selling fresh produce.
meanings.sent2: The online emporium specialized in handmade jewelry from local artisans.
meanings.sent3: In the magical emporium, you could trade your worries for wishes.
meanings.sent4: His heart was an emporium of emotions, each one vying for attention.
meanings.sent5: The emporium of dreams was where wishes came true under the starry sky.
